solid waste to leave the vehicle upon transport is a violation of this section.
   B.   All vehicles shall contain the name of the company and a phone number
where the company can be reached in a conspicuous place on each vehicle.
   C.   All solid waste collectors shall pickup its dumpsters and other waste
receptacles from private property upon notice of the property owner or tenant
located on the property. Failure to pickup the dumpster or other waste
receptacle within seven (7) days of notice by the owner or tenant on the
property shall constitute a violation of this section.
   D.   Solid waste collected in a dumpster shall be promptly dumped at an
appropriate solid waste disposal site. Failure to promptly empty said dumpsters
or other waste receptacles shall be a violation of this section.
   E.   All dumpsters shall be placed back in appropriate dumpster enclosures,
with the gates closed, after being emptied by the solid waste collection
company.
   F.   All solid waste collection companies shall comply with all other
applicable federal, state or local laws or regulations.
9.   Permit Revocation. If the City determines that the permittee has committed
a violation of an applicable term or condition of any statute, ordinance, rule,
law or regulation applicable to the permit, the City shall make written demand
upon the permittee to remedy such violation. Within ten (10) days after
receiving said written notification of violation, or refusing delivery of said
written notification, of the permit, the permittee shall contact the City with
a plan to remedy said violation. Failure to submit a plan to remedy said
violation or failure to correct said violation within the time frame agreed
upon by the City and permittee, the City Administrator shall immediately revoke
the permittee's permit to operate within the City.
10.   Appeals. Any person aggrieved by the ruling, decision or interpretation
or order of the City Administrator shall have the right to appeal by filing
written notice of appeal within ten (10) business days of the ruling of the
City Administrator. The City Council, sitting as an appeal board, may affirm,
modify or vacate the City Administrator's ruling. Any person aggrieved by the
ruling of the City Council sitting as an appeal board, may file an appropriate
action in the District Court for Johnson County. Failure to file a written
notice of appeal shall constitute a waiver of the person's right to appeal and
the decision of the City Administrator shall become final.
11.   Grading, Excavation and Demolition Activities Exempted. No Permit is
required for the removal, hauling, or disposal of earth and rock material or
debris from grading, excavation or demolition activities; however, all such
materials shall be conveyed in tight vehicles, trucks or receptacles so
constructed and maintained that none of the material being transported spills
upon any public right-of-way.
(Ord. 2020-1008 - Aug. 21 Supp.)
CHAPTER 107
UTILITY BILLING AND COLLECTION
 
107.01 Purpose                      107.06 Lien for Nonpayment
107.02 Combined Service Accounts    107.07 Lien Exemption
107.03 Utility Rates                107.08 Lien Notice
107.04 Billing for Combined Service 107.09 Accounts for Residential Rental
Accounts                            Property
107.05 Service Discontinued
 
107.01 PURPOSE.
The purpose of this chapter is to provide for the collection of rates and
charges to pay the expenses of operation and maintenance of the City utilities.
107.02 COMBINED SERVICE ACCOUNTS.
Each customer of the City shall be billed via a combined service account. Each
combined service account shall include, when applicable:
1.   Water Rate.
2.   Sewer Rate
3.   Solid Waste Collection Fee.
4.   Storm Water Rate.
107.03 UTILITY RATES.
1.   Water Rate. Each single-family residential customer of the City shall pay
the City a minimum charge of $7.44 per month for usage of 0 to 200 cubic feet,
as measured by the water meter beginning July 1, 2022 through June 30, 2023.
Each commercial or industrial customer of the City shall pay the City a minimum
charge of $12.80 for usage of 0 to 200 cubic square feet beginning July 1, 2022
through June 30, 2023. In addition to the minimum monthly charge, every
customer shall also pay to the City $1.92 per 100 cubic feet of usage for any
usage above 200 cubic feet starting July 1, 2022 through June 30, 2023. Each
single-family residential customer of the City shall pay the City a minimum
charge of $7.85 per month for usage of 0 to 200 cubic feet, as measured by the
water meter beginning July 1, 2023 through June 30, 2024. Each commercial or
industrial customer of the City shall pay the City a minimum charge of $13.50
for usage of 0 to 200 cubic square feet beginning July 1, 2023 through June 30,
2024. In addition to the minimum monthly charge, every customer shall also pay
to the City $2.03 per 100 cubic feet of usage for any usage above 200 cubic
feet starting July 1, 2023 through June 30, 2024. Each single-family
residential customer of the City shall pay the City a minimum charge of $8.29
per month for usage of 0 to 200 cubic feet, as measured by the water meter
beginning July 1, 2024 through June 30, 2025. Each commercial or industrial
customer of the City shall pay the City a minimum charge of $14.20 for usage of
0 to 200 cubic square feet beginning July 1, 2024 through June 30, 2025. In
addition to the minimum monthly charge, every customer shall also pay to the
City $2.14 per 100 cubic feet of usage for any usage above 200 cubic feet
starting July 1, 2024 through June 30, 2025. Each single-family residential
customer of the City shall pay the City a minimum charge of $8.75 per month for
usage of 0 to 200 cubic feet, as measured by the water meter beginning July 1,
2025. Each commercial or industrial customer of the City shall pay the City a
minimum charge of $15.00 for usage of 0 to 200 cubic square feet beginning July
1, 2025. In addition to the minimum monthly charge, every customer shall also
pay to the City $2.25 per 100 cubic feet of usage for any usage above 200 cubic
feet starting July 1, 2025.
(Ord. 2022-1004 – Mar. 23 Supp.)
2.   Sewer Rate. Each sewer customer of the City shall pay a minimum charge of
$13.75 per month for usage of 0 to 200 cubic feet as measured by the water
meter beginning July 1, 2019. In addition to the minimum monthly charge, the
customer shall also pay to the City $4.40 per 100 cubic feet of usage for any
usage above 200 cubic feet beginning July 1, 2019.
(Ord. 2019-1007 – Jun. 20 Supp.)
3.   Solid Waste Collection Fee. The fee for solid waste collection and
disposal service, used or available to the customer, is $14.75 per month for
each family unit starting July 1, 2022 through June 30, 2023. The fee for solid
waste collection and disposal service, used or available to the customer, is
$16.50 per month for each family unit starting July 1, 2023. In addition to the
monthly fee for each family unit, a fee of $4.17 per month for each family unit
shall be collected for each customer who uses a 35-gallon container, and a fee
of $7.00 per month shall be collected for each customer who uses a 65-gallon
container.
(Ord. 2022-1004 – Mar. 23 Supp.)
4.   Storm Water Utility Rate. Each customer shall pay to the City a storm
water utility charge that is calculated as determined in Section
102.08 of this Code of Ordinances.
107.04 BILLING FOR COMBINED SERVICE ACCOUNT.
1.   Bills Issued. The Water Department shall prepare, date and issue bills for
combined service accounts. Bills shall be deemed issued as of the date of
mailing.
2.   Bills Payable. Bills for combined service shall be due and payable at the
Water Department office within twenty-one (21) days of the date of issue. Bills
not paid when due shall be considered delinquent.
3.   Administrative Fees. Bills that are considered delinquent shall be
assessed an administrative fee equal to 10% of the billed amount due for water
service. A delivery charge of $20.00 shall be assessed to customers served with
a 48-hour shutoff notice.
4.   Billing Cycle. Bills for all combined service accounts shall be issued
monthly.
(Ord. 2011-1007 – Dec. 11 Supp.)
5.   Billing Adjustments. A bill adjustment to a utility account will be made
by the Utility Billing Clerk when it is discovered that a customer has been
incorrectly billed for water, sewer, solid waste or storm water services. Any
billing adjustments shall be calculated for the preceding three years from the
date the error was discovered or when the customer opened the account,
whichever is the lesser time period. No interest will be charged by the City
for underbilling the customer, and conversely, no interest will be paid by the
City for overbilling the customer.
6.   Dishonored Check/Bank Draft. In the event that a customer’s check, bank
draft, automatic debit, electronic fund transfer or similar financial
instrument is not honored by the customer’s financial institution for any
reason when presented for payment to the City for the first time, the
customer’s account shall immediately be deemed unpaid and delinquent the same
as if the customer had made no payment at all. The customer shall be notified
via ordinary mail regarding said delinquency. The account must be paid in full
by cash or certified funds to avoid disconnection of services. An
administrative fee of $15.00 is added to the account for each dishonored check
or bank draft.
7.   Deposits. Prior to the activation of a residential rental account, a
commercial or industrial account, the person responsible for the account shall
make a deposit in the amount as set by resolution of the Council, said amount
not to exceed the usual cost of 90 days of service for water service. After the
account is finalized, the amount of the final utility bill will be deducted
from the deposit amount, and the remainder of the deposit, if any, shall be
returned to the customer within 30 days.
8.   Activation Fee. The responsible party on any new utility billing account
shall pay a nonrefundable activation fee in an amount of $30.00. This charge
shall be assessed and collected on the first utility bill issued to the new
utility billing account. This activation fee is not transferable to a different
location within the City.
107.05 SERVICE DISCONTINUED.
All of the services billed to the premises as a combined service account may be
discontinued after the following procedure has been followed:
1.   Notice. The Utility Billing Clerk shall notify each delinquent customer
that service will be discontinued if payment of the combined service account,
including administrative fees, is not received by the date specified in the
notice of delinquency. Such notice shall be sent by ordinary mail to the
customer in whose name the delinquent charges were incurred and shall inform
the customer of the nature of the delinquency and afford the customer the
opportunity for a hearing prior to the discontinuance.
2.   Notice to Landlords. If the customer is a tenant, and if the owner or
landlord of the property or premises has made a written request for notice, the
notice of delinquency shall also be given to the owner or landlord.
3.   Hearing. If a hearing is requested by noon of the day preceding the shut
off, the City Clerk and the Water Superintendent shall conduct an informal
hearing and shall make a determination as to whether the disconnection is
justified. The customer has the right to appeal the staff’s decision to the
Council, and if the Council finds that disconnection is justified, then such
disconnection shall be made, unless payment of all charges and fees has been
received.
4.   Fees. A fee of forty-five dollars ($45.00), plus the amount of the
delinquent bill, shall be charged before service is restored to a delinquent
customer during normal business hours and a fee of seventy-five dollars
($75.00), plus the amount of the delinquent bill, shall be charged to restore
service to a delinquent customer after business hours.
107.06 LIEN FOR NONPAYMENT.
The owner of the premises served and any tenant thereof shall be jointly and
severally liable for utility service charges to the premises. Utility service
charges remaining unpaid and delinquent shall constitute a lien upon the
premises served, except as described in Section
107.07, and shall be certified by the Utility Billing Clerk to the County
Treasurer for collection in the same manner as property taxes.
107.07 LIEN EXEMPTION.
The lien for nonpayment shall not apply to a residential rental property where
water service is separately metered and the rates or charges for the water
service, sewer service, solid waste collection, and storm water drainage system
are paid directly by the tenant, if the landlord gives written notice to the
City that the property is residential rental property and that the tenant is
responsible for the rates or charges. The landlord’s written notice shall
contain the name of the tenant responsible for charges, the address of the
rental property and the date of occupancy. A change in tenant shall require a
new written notice to be given to the City within ten (10) business days of the
change in tenant. The lien exemption does not apply to delinquent charges for
repairs to a water service.
107.08 LIEN NOTICE.
A lien for delinquent utility service charges shall not be certified to the
County Treasurer unless prior written notice of intent to certify a lien is
given to the customer in whose name the delinquent charges were incurred. If
the customer is a tenant and if the owner or landlord of the property or
premises has made a written request for notice, the notice shall also be given
to the owner or landlord. The notice shall be sent to the appropriate persons
by ordinary mail not less than thirty (30) days prior to certification of the
lien to the County Treasurer. In the event a lien is certified to the County
Treasurer, a $5.00 administrative fee shall be added to the amount to be
certified to the Treasurer.
107.09 ACCOUNTS FOR RESIDENTIAL RENTAL PROPERTY.
The owner of residential rental property shall, within ten days of a change in
tenancy, report the same of the new tenant to the Utility Billing Clerk or
direct the Utility Billing Clerk to place the utility billing account in the
owner’s name. In the event that this does not occur, the Water Department shall
discontinue water service at the property.
FRANCHISES AND OTHER SERVICES
CHAPTER 110
NATURAL GAS FRANCHISE
110.01 Grant of Franchise                     110.09 Right-of-Way Restoration
110.02 Nonexclusive Grant                     110.10 Mapping Information
110.03 Limit of Grant                         110.11 Indemnification
110.04 Regulation                             110.12 Eminent Domain
110.05 Right to Operate and Locate Facilities 110.13 Assignment
110.06 Obligation to Relocate                 110.14 Notice of Default
110.07 Permits Requirements                   110.15 Franchise Fee Assessed
110.08 Street Accessions
 
110.01 GRANT OF FRANCHISE.
There is hereby granted to MidAmerican Energy Company, an Iowa Corporation, its
successors and assigns (“Company”), the right, and franchise from and after the
effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter, to acquire,
construct, operate, and maintain in the City, as provided herein, the necessary
facilities for the distribution, transmission, and sale of natural gas for
public and private use and to construct and maintain over, upon, across and
under the streets, highways, avenues, alleys and bridges, the necessary
facilities, fixtures and equipment for such purposes. This franchise shall be
effective for up to two 10-year periods, with the first 10-year period
beginning on the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter.† 4
The City may exercise an option to re-evaluate or amend the franchise by
providing the Company written notice setting forth its proposed amendments or
items that it wishes to be re-evaluated no more than 180 days or less than 90
days prior to the end of tenth year of the first 10-year franchise period. The
purpose of this notice is to expedite discussions between the Company and the
City and shall not be an exclusive list of City issues. Upon delivery of such
notice, the City and Company shall meet to attempt to consider the City
amendments and other items. If the City and Company are unable to agree to
amend the franchise and address other issues by the end of the first 10-year
period, either party may terminate the franchise agreement effective on the
last day of the first ten-year period. If no written request to amend or
terminate the franchise is delivered by City to Company between 180 and 90 days
prior to the end of the first ten-year period, the franchise shall continue for
a second 10-year period, or for 20 years.
 
Notes
4 † EDITOR’S NOTE: Ordinance No. 2008-1006, adopting a natural gas franchise for the
  City, was passed and adopted on May 13, 2008.
110.02 NONEXCLUSIVE GRANT.
The franchise shall not be exclusive and shall not restrict in any manner the
right of the City Council or any other governing body of the City in the
exercise of any governmental power which it may have or hereafter be authorized
or permitted by laws of the State of Iowa.
110.03 LIMIT OF GRANT.
The franchise is limited to natural gas service. No other services shall be
provided to the public by the Company hereunder.
110.04 REGULATION.
The City reserves to itself the right to make reasonable regulation of the
Company’s use of streets and to extend this franchise to other public places
upon request from the Company.
110.05 RIGHT TO OPERATE AND LOCATE FACILITIES.
The Company shall have the right to excavate and install, construct, and
maintain all necessary mains, pipes, services, fixtures and accessories for the
distribution of natural gas in and through the City. Said facilities shall not
unreasonably interfere with the construction of any water pipes, drain or
sewer, or the flow of water therefrom, which have been or may hereafter be
located by authority of the City.
110.06 OBLIGATION TO RELOCATE.
The Company shall, consistent with Section
110.07 hereof, at its cost and expense, locate and relocate its installations
in, on, over or under any public street or alley in the City in such manner as
the City may at any time reasonably require for the purposes of facilitating
the construction, reconstruction, maintenance or repair of the street or alley
or any public improvement of, in or about any such street or alley or
reasonably promoting the efficient operation of any such improvement.
110.07 PERMITS REQUIREMENTS.
The Company will comply with the permitting requirements in
Chapter 141 of this Code of Ordinances or future ordinances consistent with
this chapter; however, no permit shall be required prior to commencing and
completing work in the event of an emergency. The Company will obtain a permit
within two (2) business days following restoration of service or the abatement
of the emergency. If the Company is doing work to facilitate a City project, no
permit fees shall be required to be paid by the Company.
110.08 STREET ACCESSIONS.
Where any natural gas mains, pipes, service lines or other facilities are
presently or in the future placed anywhere in the corporate limits of the City,
either as now existing or hereafter extended, not in a public street and a
street shall thereafter be opened or dedicated so as to include said line
within the right-of-way of such street, said natural gas facilities shall be
then operated and maintained under the terms of the franchise, provided the
Company first receives reasonable compensation for any property rights foregone
thereby.
110.09 RIGHT-OF-WAY RESTORATION.
In making excavations in any streets, avenues, alleys and public places the
Company shall not unreasonably obstruct the use of the streets, and shall
replace the surface, restoring the original condition in compliance with
Chapter 141 of this Code of Ordinances.
110.10 MAPPING INFORMATION.
Upon reasonable request the Company shall provide the City, on a project
specific basis, information indicating the horizontal location, relative to
boundaries of the right-of-way, of all equipment which it owns or over which it
has control that is located in City right-of-way. (Mapping information shall be
in a digital format that can be used by Autodesk AutoCAD software and may be
.dwg (native AutoCAD drawing file), .shp (ESRI shapefile) or .e00 (ESRI ArcInfo
interchange file). (Data is preferred, but not required, to be submitted in the
following projection: Zone Iowa South 1402, NAD83 [1996], NAVD 1988, State
Plane US Survey feet.) If the Company cannot provide any of the file types thus
specified, then the data may be submitted in .pdf (Adobe Portable Document
Format). The parties recognize that during the term of the franchise the
digital format may from time to time change and they will consult to provide
the required information in a manner consistent with the first sentence of this
section. In the event the Company cannot provide the information in a digital
or electronic format consistent with City data systems the Company shall
provide the information in a printed or drawn format on paper. The Company and
City recognize the information provided will, under current Iowa law,
constitute public records, but that nonetheless, some information provided will
be confidential under State or Federal law or both. Therefore, the City shall
not release any information with respect to the location or type of equipment
which the Company owns or controls in the right-of-way which may constitute a
trade secret or which may otherwise be protected from public disclosure by
State or Federal law. The City shall provide the Company written notice of the
request to release information to allow the Company to determine if the
information sought is confidential. The Company shall respond to the City
within 5 business days of receiving the City’s written notice request. If
requested by the Company, the City shall not release any such data except by
court order; provided, however, the City reserves the right to disagree with
the Company determination that the information is confidential, in which case
the Company shall be given notice in order that the Company may seek injunctive
relief. In the event the City agrees the information is confidential, or that a
court determination is required to determine if the information is
confidential, the City shall defend or bring any necessary court actions,
provided, however, that in the event the City refuses to release records, or
the City itself brings an action to determine if records are confidential, the
City may tender the defense or prosecution of such legal actions to the Company
and the Company shall accept such tender. Nothing in this section shall limit
or be construed as limiting the right of the City to use the information
provided for regulatory or other public purposes. The Company will attempt to
provide accurate data, but the Company cannot and does not warrant or guarantee
that data provided may be used for any particular purpose and the accuracy of
the data provided is not to be relied upon by any person or other entity which
receives the information from the City without further consultation with the
Company regarding purposes and uses.
110.11 INDEMNIFICATION.
The Company shall indemnify and hold the City harmless at all times during the
term of the franchise from and against all claims for injury or damage to
persons or property caused by the Company’s negligence in the construction,
erection, operation or maintenance of its properties, or the negligence of its
contractors or its employees; provided, however, the Company shall not be
obligated to defend, indemnify or save harmless the City for any costs or
damages arising from the negligence of the City, its officers, employees or
contractors. In case of any suit or action at law being commenced against the
City, upon any claim for damage arising out of any loss, injury or damage
claimed to have been caused by the Company’s negligence during installation,
improvement, obstruction or excavation in any street, alley, sidewalk or public
place in the City, and which installation, improvement, obstruction or
excavation was made or left in, under or upon such street, sidewalk, alley or
public place by said Company, its agents, contractors or employees, upon being
notified in writing by the City of such action or proceeding, the Company shall
appear and make proper defense thereto; and if any judgment or decree shall in
any such case be rendered against the City therein, the Company hereby agrees
to assume, pay and satisfy such judgment or decree, with the costs thereof.
110.12 EMINENT DOMAIN.
The franchise grants the Company the right to exercise powers of eminent domain
without further authorization from the City.
110.13 ASSIGNMENT.
The Company shall file in the office of the City Clerk written notice of any
proposed sale, transfer, disposition or assignment of the franchise or change
in ownership of the Company.
110.14 NOTICE OF DEFAULT.
If either party determines there is a default under the franchise the other
party shall be given written notice describing the default in detail, whether a
forfeiture or termination of the franchise will be sought and where curable a
reasonable time to cure the default which shall not be less than 60 or more
than 180 days.
110.15 FRANCHISE FEE ASSESSED.
MidAmerican Energy Company shall assess a 1% franchise fee on the gross
revenues generated from the sales of natural gas within the City and pay the
same to the City in compliance with applicable law. At any time during the term
of the franchise agreement, the City Council may amend or repeal said franchise
fee by adoption of a subsequent ordinance.
CHAPTER 111A
ELECTRIC FRANCHISE - MIDAMERICAN ENERGY COMPANY
111A.01 Grant of Franchise                     111A.09 Right-of-Way Restoration
111A.02 Nonexclusive Grant                     111A.10 Tree Trimming
111A.03 Limit of Grant                         111A.11 Mapping Information
111A.04 Regulation                             111A.12 Indemnification
111A.05 Right to Operate and Locate Facilities 111A.13 Eminent Domain
111A.06 Obligation to Relocate                 111A.14 Assignment
111A.07 Permits Requirements                   111A.15 Notice of Default
111A.08 Street Accessions                      111A.16 Franchise Fee Assessed
 
111A.01 GRANT OF FRANCHISE.
There is hereby granted to MidAmerican Energy Company, an Iowa Corporation, its
successors and assigns (“Company”), the right, and franchise, from and after
the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter, to acquire,
construct, operate and maintain in the City, as provided herein, the necessary
facilities for the distribution, transmission and sale of electricity for
public and private use and to construct and maintain over, upon, across and
under the streets, highways, avenues, alleys and bridges, the necessary
facilities, fixtures and equipment for such purposes. The franchise shall be
effective for up to two 10-year periods with the first 10-year period beginning
on the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter.† 5   The City
may exercise an option to re-evaluate or amend the franchise by providing the
Company written notice setting forth its proposed amendments or items that it
wishes to be re-evaluated no more than 180 days or less than 90 days prior to
the end of tenth year of the first 10-year franchise period. The purpose of
this notice is to expedite discussions between the Company and the City and
shall not be an exclusive list of City issues. Upon delivery of such notice,
the City and Company shall meet to attempt to consider the City amendments and
other items. If the City and Company are unable to agree to amend the ordinance
and address other issues by the end of the first 10-year period, either party
may terminate the franchise agreement effective on the last day of the first
ten-year period. If no written request to amend or terminate the franchise is
delivered by City to Company between 180 and 90 days prior to the end of the
first ten-year period, the franchise shall continue for a second 10-year
period, or for 20 years.
 
Notes
5 † Ordinance No. 2008-1007, adopting an electric franchise for the City was
  passed and adopted on May 13, 2008.
111A.02 NONEXCLUSIVE GRANT.
The franchise shall not be exclusive and shall not restrict in any manner the
right of the City Council or any other governing body of the City in the
exercise of any governmental power which it may have or hereafter be authorized
or permitted by laws of the State of Iowa.
111A.03 LIMIT OF GRANT.
The franchise is limited to electrical service. No other services shall be
provided to the public by the Company hereunder.
111A.04 REGULATION.
The City reserves to itself the right to make reasonable regulation of the
Company’s use of streets and to extend this franchise to other public places
upon request from the Company.
111A.05 RIGHT TO OPERATE AND LOCATE FACILITIES.
The Company shall have the right to erect and maintain all necessary poles and
to place thereon the necessary wires, fixtures and accessories as well as
excavate and bury conductors and install and place other underground electric
system facilities and fixtures for the distribution of electric energy in and
through the City. Said facilities shall not unreasonably interfere with the
construction of any water pipes, drain or sewer, or the flow of water
therefrom, which have been or may hereafter be located by authority of the
City.
111A.06 OBLIGATION TO RELOCATE.
The Company shall, consistent with Section
111A.07 hereof, at its cost and expense, locate and relocate its installations
in, on, over or under any public street or alley in the City in such manner as
the City may at any time reasonably require for the purposes of facilitating
the construction, reconstruction, maintenance or repair of the street or alley
or any public improvement of, in or about any such street or alley or
reasonably promoting the efficient operation of any such improvement.
111A.07 PERMITS REQUIREMENTS.
The Company will comply with the permitting requirements in
Chapter 141 of this Code of Ordinances or future ordinances consistent with
this chapter; however, no permit shall be required prior to commencing and
completing work in the event of an emergency or electric outage. In the event
of an emergency, the Company will obtain a permit within two (2) business days
following restoration of service or the abatement of the emergency. If the
Company is doing work to facilitate a City project, no permit fees shall be
required to be paid by the Company.
111A.08 STREET ACCESSIONS.
Where any electric distribution or service line is presently or in the future
placed anywhere in the corporate limits of the City, either as now existing or
hereafter extended, not in a public street and a street shall thereafter be
opened or dedicated so as to include said line within the right-of-way of such
street, said electric line shall be then operated and maintained under the
terms of this chapter, provided the Company first receives reasonable
compensation for any property rights foregone thereby .
111A.09 RIGHT-OF-WAY RESTORATION.
In making excavations in any streets, avenues, alleys and public places the
Company shall not unreasonably obstruct the use of the streets, and shall
replace the surface, restoring the original condition in compliance with
Chapter 141 of this Code of Ordinances.
111A.10 TREE TRIMMING.
The Company is authorized and empowered consistent with this chapter to prune
or remove at Company expense any tree extending into any street, alley, right-
of-way or public grounds to maintain electric reliability, safety, to restore
utility service and to prevent limbs, branches or trunks from interfering with
the wires and facilities of the Company. The pruning shall be completed in
accordance with nationally accepted safety and utility industry standards, ANSI
A300-2001, American National Standard for Tree Care Operations, and ANSI Z133-
2006 Pruning, Repairing, Maintaining and Removing Trees, and Cutting Brush
Safety Requirements, or subsequent revisions to these standards, and City
ordinances regarding the trimming of trees and the protection of its facilities
upon public grounds. The removal of trees or pruning in public grounds other
than public right-of-ways excluding emergency and outage situations shall
require prior approval from the City.
111A.11 MAPPING INFORMATION.
Upon reasonable request the Company shall provide the City, on a project
specific basis, information indicating the horizontal location, relative to
boundaries of the right-of-way, of all equipment which it owns or over which it
has control that is located in City right-of-way. (Mapping information shall be
in a digital format that can be used by Autodesk AutoCAD software and may be
.dwg (native AutoCAD drawing file), .shp (ESRI shapefile) or .e00 (ESRI ArcInfo
interchange file). (Data is preferred, but not required, to be submitted in the
following projection: Zone Iowa South 1402, NAD83 [1996], NAVD 1988, State
Plane US Survey feet.) If the Company cannot provide any of the file types thus
specified, then the data may be submitted in .pdf (Adobe Portable Document
Format). The parties recognize that during the term of the franchise the
digital format may from time to time change and they will consult to provide
the required information in a manner consistent with the first sentence of this
section. In the event the Company cannot provide the information in a digital
or electronic format consistent with City data systems the Company shall
provide the information in a printed or drawn format on paper. The Company and
City recognize the information provided will, under current Iowa law,
constitute public records, but that nonetheless, some information provided will
be confidential under State or Federal law or both. Therefore, the City shall
not release any information with respect to the location or type of equipment
which the Company owns or controls in the right-of-way which may constitute a
trade secret or which may otherwise be protected from public disclosure by
State or Federal law. The City shall provide the Company written notice of the
request to release information to allow the Company to determine if the
information sought is confidential. The Company shall respond to the City
within 5 business days of receiving the City’s written notice request. If
requested by the Company, the City shall not release any such data except by
court order; provided, however, the City reserves the right to disagree with
the Company determination that the information is confidential, in which case
the Company shall be given notice in order that the Company may seek injunctive
relief. In the event the City agrees the information is confidential, or that a
court determination is required to determine if the information is
confidential, the City shall defend or bring any necessary court actions,
provided, however, that in the event the City refuses to release records, or
the City itself brings an action to determine if records are confidential, the
City may tender the defense or prosecution of such legal actions to the Company
and the Company shall accept such tender. Nothing in this section shall limit
or be construed as limiting the right of the City to use the information
provided for regulatory or other public purposes. The Company will attempt to
provide accurate data, but the Company cannot and does not warrant or guarantee
that data provided may be used for any particular purpose and the accuracy of
the data provided is not to be relied upon by any person or other entity which
receives the information from the City without further consultation with the
Company regarding purposes and uses.
111A.12 INDEMNIFICATION.
The Company shall indemnify and hold the City harmless at all times during the
term of the franchise from and against all claims for injury or damage to
persons or property caused by the Company’s negligence in the construction,
erection, operation or maintenance of its properties, or the negligence of its
contractors or its employees; provided, however, the Company shall not be
obligated to defend, indemnify or save harmless the City for any costs or
damages arising from the negligence of the City, its officers, employees or
contractors. In case of any suit or action at law being commenced against the
City, upon any claim for damage arising out of any loss, injury or damage
claimed to have been caused by the Company’s negligence during installation,
improvement, obstruction or excavation in any street, alley, sidewalk or public
place in the City, and which installation, improvement, obstruction or
excavation was made or left in, under or upon such street, sidewalk, alley or
public place by said Company, its agents, contractors or employees, upon being
notified in writing by the City of such action or proceeding, the Company shall
appear and make proper defense thereto; and if any judgment or decree shall in
any such case be rendered against the City therein, the Company hereby agrees
to assume, pay and satisfy such judgment or decree, with the costs thereof.
111A.13 EMINENT DOMAIN.
This chapter grants the Company the right to exercise powers of eminent domain
without further authorization from the City.
111A.14 ASSIGNMENT.
The Company shall file in the office of the City Clerk written notice of any
proposed sale, transfer, disposition or assignment of this franchise or change
in ownership of the Company.
111A.15 NOTICE OF DEFAULT.
If either party determines there is a default under this chapter the other
party shall be given written notice describing the default in detail, whether a
forfeiture or termination of the franchise will be sought and where curable a
reasonable time to cure the default which shall not be less than 60 or more
than 180 days.
111A.16 FRANCHISE FEE ASSESSED.
MidAmerican Energy Company shall assess a 1% franchise fee on the gross
revenues generated from the sales of electricity within the City and pay the
same to the City in compliance with applicable law. At any time during the term
of the franchise agreement, the City Council may amend or repeal said franchise
fee by adoption of a subsequent ordinance.
CHAPTER 111B
ELECTRIC FRANCHISE - LINN COUNTY RURAL ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION
111B.01 Grant of Franchise                     111B.10 Right-of-Way Restoration
111B.02 Nonexclusive Grant                     111B.11 Tree Trimming
111B.03 Limit of Grant                         111B.12 Mapping Information
111B.04 Regulation                             111B.13 Indemnification

111B.01 GRANT OF FRANCHISE.
There is hereby granted to Linn County Rural Electric Cooperative Association,
an Iowa Cooperative, its successors and assigns (“Company”), the right, and
franchise, from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this
chapter, to acquire, construct, operate and maintain in the City, as provided
herein, the necessary facilities for the distribution, transmission and sale of
electricity for public and private use and to construct and maintain over,
upon, across and under the streets, highways, avenues, alleys and bridges, the
necessary facilities, fixtures and equipment for such purposes. The franchise
shall be effective for up to two 10-year periods with the first 10-year period
beginning on the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter.† 6  
Either party may exercise an option to re-evaluate or amend the franchise by
providing the other party written notice setting forth its proposed amendments
or items that it wishes to be re-evaluated no more than 180 days or less than
90 days prior to the end of tenth year of the first 10-year franchise period.
The purpose of this notice is to expedite discussions between the Company and
the City and shall not be an exclusive list of the first party’s issues. Upon
delivery of such notice, the City and Company shall meet to attempt to consider
the proposed amendments and other items. If the City and Company are unable to
agree to amend the ordinance and address other issues by the end of the first
10-year period, either party may terminate the franchise agreement effective on
the last day of the first ten-year period. If no written request to amend or
terminate the franchise is delivered by either party to the other between 180
and 90 days prior to the end of the first ten-year period, the franchise shall
continue for a second 10-year period, or for 20 years.
 
Notes
6 † Ordinance No. 2010-1009, adopting an electric franchise for the City was
  passed and adopted on May 25, 2010.
111B.02 NONEXCLUSIVE GRANT.
The franchise shall not be exclusive and shall not restrict in any manner the
right of the City Council or any other governing body of the City in the
exercise of any governmental power which it may have or hereafter be authorized
or permitted by laws of the State of Iowa.
111B.03 LIMIT OF GRANT.
The franchise is limited to electrical service. No other services shall be
provided to the public by the Company hereunder.
111B.04 REGULATION.
The City reserves to itself the right to make reasonable regulation of the
Company’s use of streets and to extend this franchise to other public places
upon request from the Company. The Company shall comply with this Code of
Ordinances to the extent not inconsistent with the rights, privileges,
restrictions and limitations of the Code of Iowa or as subsequently amended or
changed and the applicable regulations of the Iowa Utilities Board and Federal
law.
111B.05 RIGHT TO OPERATE AND LOCATE FACILITIES.
The Company shall have the right to erect and maintain all necessary poles and
to place thereon the necessary wires, fixtures and accessories as well as
excavate and bury conductors and install and place other underground electric
system facilities and fixtures for the distribution of electric energy in and
through the City. Said facilities shall not unreasonably interfere with the
construction of any water pipes, drain or sewer, or the flow of water
therefrom, which have been or may hereafter be located by authority of the
City.
111B.06 OBLIGATION TO RELOCATE.
The Company shall, at its cost and expense, locate and relocate its
installations in, on, over or under any public street or alley in the City in
such manner as the City may at any time reasonably require for the purposes of
facilitating the construction, reconstruction, maintenance or repair of the
street or alley or any public improvement of, in or about any such street or
alley or reasonably promoting the efficient operation of any such improvement.
111B.07 PERMITS REQUIREMENTS.
The Company will comply with the permitting requirements in
Chapter 141 of this Code of Ordinances; however, no permit shall be required
prior to commencing and completing work in the event of an emergency or
electric outage. The Company will obtain a permit within seven (7) business
days following restoration of service or the abatement of the emergency. If the
Company is doing work to facilitate a City project, Company shall obtain a
permit, but no permit fees shall be required to be paid by the Company.
111B.08 ABANDONED FACILITIES.
The Company shall not be required to remove abandoned facilities from the right
of way if the act of removal causes degradation of the right of way, potential
damage to other facilities, or if the Company facilities may, at a reasonable
future date, be placed back into service. The City may require the Company to
demonstrate the potential for any of these circumstances.
111B.09 STREET ACCESSIONS.
Where any electric distribution or service line is presently or in the future
placed anywhere in the corporate limits of the City, either as now existing or
hereafter extended, not in a public street and a street shall thereafter be
opened or dedicated so as to include said line within the right-of-way of such
street, said electric line shall be then operated and maintained under the
terms of this chapter, provided the Company first receives reasonable
compensation for any property rights foregone thereby .
111B.10 RIGHT-OF-WAY RESTORATION.
In making excavations in any streets, avenues, alleys and public places the
Company shall not unreasonably obstruct the use of the streets, and shall
replace the surface, restoring the original condition in compliance with
Chapter 141 of this Code of Ordinances.
111B.11 TREE TRIMMING.
The Company is authorized and empowered consistent with this chapter to prune
or remove at Company expense any tree extending into any street, alley, right-
of-way or public grounds to maintain electric reliability, safety, to restore
utility service and to prevent limbs, branches or trunks from interfering with
the wires and facilities of the Company. The pruning shall be completed in
accordance with nationally accepted safety and utility industry standards, ANSI
A300-2001, American National Standard for Tree Care Operations, and ANSI Z133-
2006 Pruning, Repairing, Maintaining and Removing Trees, and Cutting Brush
Safety Requirements, or subsequent revisions to these standards, and City
ordinances regarding the trimming of trees and the protection of its facilities
upon public grounds. The removal of trees or pruning in public grounds other
than public right-of-ways excluding emergency and outage situations shall
require prior approval from the City.
111B.12 MAPPING INFORMATION.
Upon reasonable request the Company shall provide the City, on a project
specific basis, information indicating the horizontal location, relative to
boundaries of the right-of-way, of all equipment which it owns or over which it
has control that is located in project right-of-way. Mapping information
provided to the City by the Company shall be in the format utilized by the
Company and shall be for the exclusive use of the City in administering the use
and occupancy of the public rights-of-way within the City and shall not be
provided to or relied on by any person for any other purpose. Any information
provided to the City with respect to the location or type of equipment which
the Company owns or plans to install in the right-of-way shall be treated as
confidential information or a trade secret and shall not be released to any
party by the City without the prior written consent of the Company. If
requested, the Company shall submit to the City complete mapping data specific
to particular projects. At the request of the City, mapping information will be
reviewed with the City staff. Company does not warrant or guarantee the
accuracy of any information provided pursuant to this section. Company’s maps
only show equipment and facilities that are above ground. All mapping
information provided by Company to City shall be governed by the following
provisions:
1.   Company is not responsible for any hardware or software needed to access
and use the product and information therein.
2.   The GIS data provided by Company contains information that is proprietary
and confidential. The data has been developed for internal use by Company. All
data is provided as is, with all faults, and without warranty of any kind,
either express or implied, including, but not limited to, the implied
warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose.
3.   City understands and acknowledges that the information contained in the
data is subject to constant change and that its accuracy cannot be guaranteed.
Company makes no warranties or guarantees, either expressed or implied, as to
the completeness, accuracy, or correctness of such data. Company further states
that City’s use of the GIS data is done so at the risk of City.
4.   Company shall not be subject to liability for human errors, defect or
failure of machines, or any material used in connection with the GIS data,
including but not limited to tapes and disks.
5.   Company shall not be subject to liability for any lost profits or
consequential damages, or claims against City by other parties due to use of
this GIS data. The entire risk as to the quality, performance and usefulness of
the data rests with City.
6.   City releases Company and its officers, agents, consultants, contractors
and employees from any and all claims, actions or causes of action for damages
including, but not limited to, any costs of recovering, reprogramming or
reproducing any programs or data stored in or used with the GIS data, damage to
property, damages for personal injury or for any lost profits, lost savings or
other special incidental or consequential damages arising out of the use of or
inability to use the GIS data.
7.   City shall indemnify and hold harmless Company and its officers, agents,
consultants, contractors and employees from any and all liability claims or
damages to any person or property arising from or connected with City’s use of
the GIS data.
8.   Provision of the GIS data does not constitute a transfer of any title or
interest in the Company product.
9.   City may copy the GIS data provided via this agreement only for backup
purposes.
10.   City shall use the GIS data exclusively for internal use and it is not
for use by any entity other than City.
11.   City agrees to recognize and honor in perpetuity the copyrights, and
other proprietary claims for GIS data produced by Company.
111B.13 INDEMNIFICATION.
The Company shall indemnify and hold the City harmless at all times during the
term of the franchise from and against all claims for injury or damage to
persons or property caused by the Company’s negligence in the construction,
erection, operation or maintenance of its properties, or the negligence of its
contractors or its employees; provided, however, the Company shall not be
obligated to defend, indemnify or save harmless the City for any costs or
damages arising from the negligence of the City, its officers, employees or
contractors. In case of any suit or action at law being commenced against the
City, upon any claim for damage arising out of any loss, injury or damage
claimed to have been caused by the Company’s negligence during installation,
improvement, obstruction or excavation in any street, alley, sidewalk or public
place in the City, and which installation, improvement, obstruction or
excavation was made or left in, under or upon such street, sidewalk, alley or
public place by said Company, its agents, contractors or employees, upon being
notified in writing by the City of such action or proceeding, the Company shall
appear and make proper defense thereto; and if any judgment or decree shall in
any such case be rendered against the City therein, the Company hereby agrees
to assume, pay and satisfy such judgment or decree, with the costs thereof.
111B.14 EMINENT DOMAIN.
This chapter grants the Company the right to exercise powers of eminent domain
without further authorization from the City.
111B.15 ASSIGNMENT.
The Company shall file in the office of the City Clerk written notice of any
proposed sale, transfer, disposition or assignment of this franchise or change
in ownership of the Company.
111B.16 NOTICE OF DEFAULT.
If either party determines there is a default under this chapter the other
party shall be given written notice describing the default in detail, whether a
forfeiture or termination of the franchise will be sought and where curable a
reasonable time to cure the default which shall not be less than 60 or more
than 180 days.
111B.17 FRANCHISE FEE.
The City shall impose a one-percent (1%) franchise fee pursuant to the Code of
Iowa, on the gross revenue of the Company, minus uncollectible accounts,
derived from the distribution and the retail sale of electricity by the Company
to customers within the current or future corporate limits of the City. The
City shall work with the Company to develop a methodology and timeline to
implement the franchise fee. The Company may charge an administrative fee to
process a City franchise fee. At any time during the term of the franchise
agreement, the City Council may amend or repeal said franchise fee by adoption
of a subsequent ordinance.
